message.content:
Below is a worked example of how one can identify and assemble the two groupings in the target image using the blocks as shown in the dictionary (without rotating them beyond what is shown).  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN (TARGET) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  The structure divides naturally into two separate “mini‐builds”:

  LEFT BUILD (looks like a small “table” with a roof):
   –  Two orange cylinders on the ground (these form the legs).
   –  One yellow rectangular block bridging across the top of the two cylinders.
   –  One orange wedge resting on that yellow block (forming a triangular “roof”).

   This left build has three vertical “layers”:  
     ◦ Layer 1: Two orange cylinders  
     ◦ Layer 2: One horizontal yellow block bridging them  
     ◦ Layer 3: One orange wedge perched on top

  RIGHT BUILD (looks like a rectangular “door‐frame” with a wedge inside):  
   –  One horizontal green rectangular block on the ground.  
   –  Two tall yellow rectangular pillars standing on that green block (left and right).  
   –  An orange (red‐looking) wedge sitting inside at the bottom (on top of the same green block).  
   –  Another identical green rectangular block capping the top.  

   This right build also has three distinct layers:  
     ◦ Layer 1: Bottom green block  
     ◦ Layer 2: Two tall yellow pillars plus the wedge inside  
     ◦ Layer 3: Top green block  

•  TOTAL BLOCK COUNT:  9 pieces  
   – Left build: 4 blocks (2 cylinders, 1 yellow rectangle, 1 wedge)  
   – Right build: 5 blocks (2 green rectangles, 2 tall yellow rectangles, 1 wedge)  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE BLOCKS (AND THEIR INDICES)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Looking at the dictionary image:

 • Orange cylinder, vertical orientation → index 9  
 • Yellow rectangular block, horizontal orientation → index 6  
 • Orange wedge in a “roof‐type” orientation → (for example) index 12 for the left build  
 • Green rectangular block, horizontal orientation → index 4  
 • Tall yellow rectangular block, vertical orientation → index 7 (used twice)  
 • Orange wedge for the “door‐frame” interior → e.g. index 13, suited to stand on its rectangular face

Hence the exact block‐index usage is:

LEFT BUILD  
 • 2 × (index 9)  [the two orange cylinders]  
 • 1 × (index 6)  [the horizontal yellow block]  
 • 1 × (index 12) [the orange wedge “roof”]

RIGHT BUILD  
 • 2 × (index 4)  [top and bottom green blocks]  
 • 2 × (index 7)  [the two tall yellow pillars]  
 • 1 × (index 13) [the wedge inside]

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{
  Step1: Move block with index 9      (place first upright orange cylinder for left build)
  Step2: Move block with index 9      (place second upright orange cylinder for left build)
  Step3: Move block with index 6      (bridge across cylinders with the horizontal yellow block)
  Step4: Move block with index 12     (place the orange wedge “roof” on top)

  Step5: Move block with index 4      (place bottom green rectangle for right build)
  Step6: Move block with index 7      (stand first tall yellow pillar on bottom green block)
  Step7: Move block with index 7      (stand second tall yellow pillar on bottom green block)
  Step8: Move block with index 13     (place the wedge inside on the bottom green block)
  Step9: Move block with index 4      (cap the pillars with the top green rectangle)
}

Following that order (or a similar one) yields the same final arrangement as the target image, using the blocks exactly in their given orientations.
